cs.umass.edu.myactivitiestoolkit.services

Class PPGService

  • java.lang.Object
    • Service
      • cs.umass.edu.myactivitiestoolkit.services.SensorService
        • cs.umass.edu.myactivitiestoolkit.services.PPGService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PPGListener, edu.umass.cs.MHLClient.client.ConnectionStateHandler

    public class PPGService
extends SensorService
implements PPGListener
    Photoplethysmography service. This service uses a HeartRateCameraView to collect PPG data using a standard camera with continuous flash. This is where you will do most of your work for this assignment.

    ASSIGNMENT (PHOTOPLETHYSMOGRAPHY) : In onSensorChanged(PPGEvent), you should smooth the PPG reading using a Filter. You should send the filtered PPG reading both to the server and to the HeartRateFragment for visualization. Then call your heart rate detection algorithm, buffering the readings if necessary, and send the bpm measurement back to the UI.

    EXTRA CREDIT: Follow the steps outlined here to acquire a cleaner PPG signal. For additional extra credit, you may also try computing the heart rate variability from the heart rate, as they do.
    See Also:
    HeartRateCameraView, PPGEvent, PPGListener, Filter, MobileIOClient, PPGSensorReading, Service

      • onSensorChanged

        public void onSensorChanged(PPGEvent event)
        This method is called each time a PPG sensor reading is received.

        You should smooth the data using Filter and then send the filtered data both to the server and the main UI for real-time visualization. Run your algorithm to detect heart beats, calculate your current bpm and send the bmp measurement to the main UI. Additionally, it may be useful for you to send the peaks you detect to the main UI, using broadcastPeak(long, double). The plot is already set up to draw these peak points upon receiving them.

        Also make sure to send your bmp measurement to the server for visualization. You can do this using HRSensorReading.
        Specified by:
        onSensorChanged in interface PPGListener
        Parameters:
        event - The PPG sensor reading, wrapping a timestamp and mean red value.
        See Also:
        PPGEvent, PPGSensorReading, HeartRateCameraView.onPreviewFrame(byte[], Camera), MobileIOClient, HRSensorReading

      • broadcastPPGReading
